speaker: Roz
text: [_sitting_] Oh hey, Frasier.  Catalogues?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I'm trying to find the perfect wedding gift for Daphne and Donny.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, right.  Well, I guess now that they've set a date, I'll be getting my bridesmaid draft notice.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Roz, she might not even ask you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_positive_] Oh, she'll ask me.  They all do.  The next thing I know I'm wearing some revolting puffy-sleeved dress made from the same material that keeps the space shuttle from burning up on re-entry.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, Daphne might just surprise you and pick a dress you like.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, impossible.  They're always ugly; that's why the bride makes sure she's the prettiest one at the wedding.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's awfully cynical.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh yeah, when was the last time you found yourself staring at the bridesmaid instead of the bride? [_signals to the waitress_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That would have been at my wedding to Lilith. _Roz, not getting the attention of the waitress, heads over to the counter.  Then Niles enters and sits with his brother._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, do you remember the time the Kreizel brothers tied me to their Great Dane and lobbed meatballs down their gravel driveway?

speaker: Frasier
text: I've told you Niles, I would have helped you, but their sister was holding me down.

speaker: Niles
text: No, my point is - [_to waitress_] Cappuccino, please [_to Frasier_] - even that experience was less painful than the date I was just on.  She was... [_takes a cat hair from his jacket and puts it on the floor_] ...a cat person.  She brought her cat on our date.  Well, she had good reason, it was Mr. Waggles's birthday.  Actually his birthday party. Actually, his surprise birthday party.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, where on earth did you meet this woman?

speaker: Niles
text: At Nordstroms.  We both reached for the same cashmere throw and she said she needed something to keep her waggles warm. I thought it was a coy euphemism. [_the waitress brings his coffee_] Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, I certainly understand your being upset, but you know, you've got to keep on looking.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, trust me, with Daphne getting married, I have no choice but to press on.  But I'm going to change my strategy.  Do you recall, the other day at the health club, Tony Hubner gave me that phone number?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, Niles, not a dating service?

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's not a dating service.  An "Introduction Network" for busy professionals.  I've given them my vital statistics, there's an extensive screening process, they bill me at the end of the month.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, please.  They are all money-grubbing con-artists who prey on the pathetic and the lonely.  God's sakes, you sign up with visions of some Ph.D., and what do they deliver?  A buck-toothed librarian who needs help washing her mother! Are you really that desperate?

speaker: Niles
text: Half an hour ago, I had my back leg tethered to Mr. Waggles's forepaw and we came in third in the five-legged race.

speaker: Frasier
text: Geez, you'd think they'd let him win on his birthday. _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. As Frasier enters he hears Daphne on the phone to her mother._

speaker: Daphne
text: I know, mum, but it is my wedding.  I've given into you on so many things.  Couldn't this one thing go my way? [_pause_] I just don't like those tiny corns in my salad. [_pause_] No, I don't hate you. [_pause_] Well, that's just not true.  I'm glad you're alive. [_pause_] All right, all right, tiny corn it is.  I've got to run now, cheery bye. [_hangs up_] That was mum, she had a thought about the salad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Something tells me yesterday's crouton skirmish wasn't the end of it.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose she can be a bit overbearing.  But as she often points out, she is paying for the wedding and I am her only daughter and giving birth to me was so painful she did bite through a kitchen spoon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, just don't let you mother guilt you into having the wedding she wants instead of the wedding you want.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't worry, mum already promised me I could have the wedding I want, as soon as I have a daughter who gets engaged. _Daphne exits to her bedroom.  Frasier enters the kitchen where he finds Martin with a box of jerky._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hiya, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Fras.  You'll love this stuff I got from the farmer's market.  This guy takes the juiciest cut of filet mignon, slices it real thin and makes jerky out of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look Dad, I don't...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, if only I had a nice powdered Cabernet to go with it. Listen, have you given any thought to Daphne's wedding present?

speaker: Martin
text: Now Frasier, not everyone likes jerky as much as you and me.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I just want to get her something special, especially since her mother seems to be taking all the joy out of it for her.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, how about a nice piece of luggage?  You know, a good hard suitcase, like the kind people used to put stickers on to show everybody where they've been.  Remember your grandad's?  His whole life was on it: Topeka, Sioux Falls, Biloxi... it was like a map of the world.

speaker: Frasier
text: What a loss to us all that he failed to write his memoirs. I'm thinking of something that would matter to Daphne. [_hiccups_] Oh, something that shows her how we feel. [_hiccups_] Good Lord, that's a little spicy, isn't it? [_gets a bottle of water from fridge_] You know, maybe we should get something for her wedding.

speaker: Martin
text: Like what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know, her flowers, say?  That's it, we could offer to pay for her wedding flowers.

speaker: Martin
text: That's a bit pricy, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well don't worry about it, Dad. [_hiccups_] You just donate what you can and I'll pay for the rest. [_hiccups_] God, what was in that jerky?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you just ate it too fast.  Next time you have to savor it a little.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm never going to taste that vile stuff again. [_hiccups_] Oh, spoke too soon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, may I have a word with you, please?

speaker: Daphne
text: What is it, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's about you wedding gift.  Now, I know it's not traditionally the role of a friend but we consider you family, so please don't say no.  Dad and I would be honoured to pay for your wedding... [_hiccups_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_taking it in_] Pay for my wedding?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_holds out his hand but hiccups_]

speaker: Daphne
text: How wonderful! [_hugs a hiccuping Frasier_] I could never imagine.

speaker: Martin
text: What's all the hubbub?

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, just told me about your incredible wedding present. You people are heaven-sent.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm glad you like it.  You know what, we're going to throw in a piece of luggage as well.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_tearful_] I'm just so overwhelmed.

speaker: Martin
text: See, I told you, everybody loves luggage.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, she thinks we're paying for her whole wedding.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I tried to say wedding flowers, but then I hiccuped.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm not paying for her wedding.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course not, I'm just going to clear this whole thing up right now before it goes any further. [_calls_] Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: You know what this means, don't you?  Now that mum's not paying, she can't make me have it in England.  I can have my wedding how I want it, where I want it: right here. You've answered my prayers. [_cries in delight and exits back to kitchen_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s_] Could someone let Donny in?

speaker: Martin
text: Well look, Donny's a very traditional guy.  He's not going to let us pay for his wedding.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, you saw how he proposed to her; on bended knee. He's nothing but a hopeless romantic.

speaker: Donny
text: Any idiot knows you've got to pay a hooker in cash!  I'm at a meeting, I'll call you later, bye. [_hangs up and greets the rest_] I've got this client, he's in the middle of a divorce, right, and his wife finds all these charges from this place called "Executive Match."  It turns out to be a call girl service.  When she gets through with him she'll have his house, his car, she'd have his beach house too if I hadn't already taken it.  Women!

speaker: Donny
text: Hi, honey.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi sweetie. [_kisses him_] Have they told you yet?

speaker: Donny
text: Told me what?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not going to believe this, but Dr. Crane and his father have offered to pay for our entire wedding.

speaker: Donny
text: [_takes it in_] Is this a joke?

speaker: Frasier
text: It could be.

speaker: Donny
text: I mean, it's one thing for us to let your family pay, they're your parents, it's traditional.  But this is...

speaker: Frasier
text: Going too far?  Being presumptuous?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, we don't want to step on any toes.

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't think you'd be uncomfortable with this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he clearly is, Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: Donny's right!  We're not family. _Frasier and Martin try to get out of it until Donny realises his bad manners._

speaker: Donny
text: Wait, wait, wait, what am I doing?  Here you guys, you're making this lovely gesture and I'm just insulting you.  I mean if you guys are not family to Daphne, then who is?  Course you can pay for the wedding.  Thank you, thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just knew he'd see how much this meant to you.  I'm tearing up again.

speaker: Donny
text: No, don't start with the water works because you're going to get me going. [_notices jerky_] What's this?  Jerky?  Can I have some of that?

speaker: Martin
text: Help yourself.

speaker: Donny
text: [_reads box_] Made from filet mignon.  How much did this stuff set you back?

speaker: Frasier
text: You have no idea! _End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Caf e Nervosa. Daphne is going through her plans for the wedding with Frasier. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Now, as far as the reception goes, I've narrowed it down to two places.  I'm leaning towards "Captain Jonah's."  The view of the water's lovely.  But you have to walk through a whale's mouth to get inside.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hesitate to ask how you exit.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've got to run.  I've a meeting with the DJ. _Daphne leaves.  The woman seated behind Frasier, covering her head with a newspaper puts her read down, revealing herself as Roz.  She comes over._

speaker: Roz
text: I thought she'd never leave!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good God, Roz, how long have you been there?

speaker: Roz
text: Since you two walked in and trapped me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Aren't you taking this a bit too far just trying to avoid an unflattering dress?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I thought you'd say that.  That's why I've been carrying around this picture of the last time I was a bridesmaid.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, Roz, you look like you've been tented for termites.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it sounds like she's having fun planning her wedding.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, now that she can have things her way and not her mother's.

speaker: Roz
text: She's lucky you came along.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes and no.  You know, I sit here and let her make questionable choices and I say nothing because I know it's going to cost me less.  I'm sorry, I've got to change my thinking about this whole thing.  What good is my money, if I'm denying her the best gift I have to offer: my taste and expertise?  Frankly, what Daphne really deserves is the gift of Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: Suddenly that crock pot I'm giving them doesn't sound so bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shut up! _Roz exits as Niles appears from the back of the caf e with a delightful smile upon his face. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.  You look like a man who's been waiting to be asked why he's grinning.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I was just thinking about the other day when you said how you thought dating services were all a big con.  Well, I just got conned into meeting the most enchanting woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know what to say.

speaker: Niles
text: And I owe it all to "Executive Match."

speaker: Frasier
text: Now I do.  The name of this service is "Executive Match?"

speaker: Niles
text: Right, and you thought these women all beneath me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Beneath you and countless others. Niles, do you have any idea... _Then Sabrina walks in.  She looks like the average ditzy blonde. She is on her cell phone.  Niles calls her, but Sabrina signals him to pipe down and she'll be with him in a second._

speaker: Niles
text: She's always on the phone.  Whatever it is she does for a living, she's in great demand.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you have no idea what line of work Sabrina's in.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm guessing high-priced lawyer.  I heard her quote her hourly rate on the phone.  Believe me, you don't want to be on the receiving end of that bill. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I feel I must warn you...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh please, spare me your condescending advice.  Why can't you simply say you were wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: You have no idea what you're doing!

speaker: Niles
text: I know exactly what I'm doing!  And you could learn a thing or two from me, Mister One-Date-And It's Over.  I am taking it slow with Sabrina.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean you haven't?

speaker: Niles
text: ...haven't?

speaker: Frasier
text: Haven't...?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, please!  Are you mad, you don't proposition a woman like that on the first date.  Last night, I dropped her home after dinner with nothing more than a courtly kiss on the wrist. Tonight may proceed to hand holding.  If all goes well, in two weeks I shall storm the citadel of her womanhood.

speaker: Niles
text: Sabrina, this is Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, lovely to meet you.

speaker: Sabrina
text: Nice to meet you.  You really have a great brother.  He's charming and witty and intelligent and handsome. [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: I paid her to say that. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course you did! **THE GIFT OF FRASIER** _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. The room is full of things for the wedding.  The dinner table is complete with tablecloths, flowers and food.  There is a harp next to the piano.  Frasier is just showing the florist out as the doorbell sounds.  He opens the door to the dove man (who has a box of doves with him) and Daphne._

speaker: Frasier
text: Finally, the doves have arrived.  Come in, come in. [_he does_] [_to florist_] Lathbert, thank you so much for coming, lovely flowers, I'll let you know.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters and closes door_] Dr. Crane, was that the florist for my wedding?

speaker: Frasier
text: In his dreams!  God, the man's arrangements are one big cliche.  Look at this, his answer to everything is baby's breath, baby's breath, baby's breath. [_points to flowers_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Does that woman with the harp have something to do with my wedding too?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Daphne, she's selling them door to door.  Of course it's for your wedding.  She's auditioning.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, I really don't think...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh good, Daphne, you're here too.  Listen, I want to show you guys a little something I thought up for the wedding. [_acting as a minister_] It is now the time in the ceremony for the rings.  May I have them, please? _Eddie runs in with a little basket containing two rings.  He runs up and jumps on the couch, allowing Martin to take them._

speaker: Martin
text: Course, it's a lot more effective when he's in his little tux.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, it's all just a bit much, isn't it?  We don't want to turn this wedding into a circus.  Now, the dove man.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, about the doves...

speaker: Frasier
text: Just picture it, Daphne.  Aren't they something?  As you and Donny exit the church one dozen white birds of peace will be released and circle above.  Of course, we'll use fourteen in actuality - the power lines always take out a few.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, about the doves, well it just seems a little grand. I mean, what's wrong with throwing a bit of rice?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you want rice, of course, you'll have rice. [_then_] Sometimes it seems nothing I do is good enough.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, no, I suppose doves will be fine.

speaker: Martin
text: [_noticed a reverend in the kitchen_] Frasier, is that Reverend Franklin in the kitchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes it is, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: You're auditioning our minister for the wedding?

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't you think Donny and I should have a say in who marries us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, Daphne, I'm just whittling down the possibilities. The final choice is yours.

speaker: Marco
text: Who's tasting the first course?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that would me. [_Marco exits_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Who's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's Chef Marco from the Mercer Club, Daphne.  Today we'll be sampling each of our four courses.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I was planning on serving a buffet.  That way people can mingle, it's more festive.

speaker: Frasier
text: We are talking about your wedding, not brunch with all the fixin's at "Billy Bob's Blackjack Boomtown." _The doorbell sounds.  Frasier opens the door to Niles on the arm of Sabrina._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier, you remember Sabrina.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course, lovely to see you.  Niles, what are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, we're out for an afternoon of bird watching.  It's the start of mating season, you know. [_winks at Frasier_] Just wanted to introduce my new girlfriend to Dad.  Dad, this is Sabrina.

speaker: Martin
text: [_impressed_] Hey, nice to meet you.

speaker: Sabrina
text: Nice to meet you too.  I should really call my office, about how long do you think we'll be gone?

speaker: Niles
text: Er, about eight hours.

speaker: Sabrina
text: Great! _Sabrina goes off to the hallway as Frasier responds to Sabrina's last remark.  The doorbell sounds again.  Daphne answers it to Roz, who tries to get away quickly.  She has papers in her hand._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Daphne, I didn't know you were going to be here.  I just want to drop these off for Frasier. [_hands them to her_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Roz, I'm glad you dropped by, I need to talk to you about my wedding.  Do you mind if we speak in the hallway?

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, I don't have much time.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_follows her into hallway and shuts door behind her_] Well, then I'll get right to it.

speaker: Deliveryman
text: Excuse me, do you know where Dr. Crane lives?

speaker: Daphne
text: Right here, can I help you?

speaker: Deliveryman
text: I'm dropping off this bridesmaid dress.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'll take that.  I'm the bride. _The delivery man goes back down in the elevator.  As Daphne goes on with her speech, Roz examines the beautiful silk wedding dress.  She is hardly listening to Daphne._

speaker: Daphne
text: What I need to ask you is, how do you ever get Dr. Crane to listen to you...

speaker: Roz
text: Is this the bridesmaid dress?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's driving me mad.  He doesn't listen to anything I say...

speaker: Roz
text: The woman you ask to be bridesmaid gets to wear this?

speaker: Daphne
text: And the worst part is...

speaker: Roz
text: Is that silk?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, he's just like my mother, controlling and stubborn. I mean, what am I going to do?

speaker: Roz
text: [_then_] Well, Daphne, it's your wedding.  Just tell Frasier how you feel.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well that's a bit difficult for me.  You see, there was no talking to my mother.  Anytime I sort of tried all I hear is "Just do it my way, you'll thank me later."  Every time she said that I just wanted to explode.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, Frasier's a reasonable guy.  Just go in there and be direct.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're right, I'm going to and... Roz, I was going to ask you if you wanted to be one of my bridesmaids?

speaker: Roz
text: [_obvious acting_] Oh my God, are you serious?  This is coming out of nowhere.  I'd love to. [_N.B. In fact, Jane Leeves was a bridesmaid at Peri Gilpin's wedding to her husband, artist Christian Vincent._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't worry.  Once I'm in charge you won't have to wear this thing Dr. Crane picked out.  I mean, he calls this a bridesmaid dress!  The sleeves aren't even puffy. _Daphne enters the apartment as Roz angrily presses the lift button. Meanwhile, Martin and Sabrina are chatting away._

speaker: Martin
text: So, how long have you guys been seeing each other?

speaker: Sabrina
text: Let's see.  Since we've met it's been about seventeen, no, eighteen hours.

speaker: Niles
text: She actually counts the minutes we've been together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, may I see you in the kitchen?

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_confronting_] Dr. Crane, I need to talk to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not now, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nervous_] All right.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, what is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, it's about Sabrina.  She's a prostitute.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I don't like lawyers anymore than you do, but frankly a man whose face is plastered on every bus in town should be careful what terms he bandies about.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  "Executive Match" is an escort service.  One of Donny's clients was caught using them.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, does Sabrina laugh at everything you say, is she fascinated by everything about you, even your collections?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, yes.  Actually, I even showed her my rarely-seen collection of eighteenth century Portuguese bud vases.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how did she react?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if you must know, she was rather aroused.  She said she loved a man who collected porcelain and- [_clicks_] Oh my God, I'm dating a whore!  They have my credit card number, I've been running up a tab! [_looks at watch and calculates bill_] I've got to get her out of here! _Niles rushes into the living room with Frasier.  The gang are in with Reverend Franklin._

speaker: Niles
text: Sabrina, we should be going.

speaker: Martin
text: What's the hurry?  We're having a nice conversation.

speaker: Sabrina
text: Yeah, I love your dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did I mention he used to be a police officer?

speaker: Sabrina
text: Maybe we should go. [_gets up_]

speaker: Franklin
text: Surely you can stay a little while, I haven't seen Niles in ages. [_to Sabrina_] You know, I used to teach him in Sunday school.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you know Reverend, I can still remember dropping him off for his first class.  It seems like only yesterday. _Suddenly harp music begins playing.  The type that is used in movies when they are having a flashback.  Everybody thinks this weird and starts looking around only to find it to be the harp player auditioning._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, I believe I have chosen your bouquet. [_picks one up_] It's hand-woven out of pygmy orchids.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, I really need to talk to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course, Daphne.  First let's sample the Porcinni mushrooms.  They're exquisite.

speaker: Daphne
text: But I don't like mushrooms!

speaker: Frasier
text: You only think you don't, you haven't tried these.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, this is really...

speaker: Frasier
text: Try this for me, you'll thank me later.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_bursts angrily_] You'll thank me later?!  I've heard that my whole life, well, no more! [_chasing Frasier round the room_] I'm doing my wedding my way.  And if that means I want rice instead of doves and a DJ instead of a harp, then that's what I'll have.  I don't want your advice, I don't want your money and I don't want your mushrooms.  I'm in charge of this wedding now. [_picks up bouquet_] And what kind of a git walks down the aisle carrying something of pygmy orchids! _Daphne throws the bouquet angrily and marches off to her room.  Sabrina catches the bouquet and links her arm with Niles.  The two are now standing in front of Reverend Franklin as the harp player strikes up Handel's "Wedding March."  Niles takes the bouquet and throws them on the floor.  They all look at him.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Later that day, Martin and Eddie are sat at the dinner table as Frasier walks back from a visit to Daphne's room._

speaker: Martin
text: Is she all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: She's fine.  We had a nice talk.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's good.  Wedding still on track?

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Martin
text: You just got a little carried away, that's all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I guess so, yeah.  You know, it suddenly occurred to me when I was talking to Daphne that I never really got the wedding of my dreams either.  Oh sure, you know, my first one was a little clandestine affair we dashed off at the city hall.  I could have hardly imagined a wedding more lacking in ceremony.  Until my second wedding, which was lacking a bride. Then came Lilith.  If I knew then what I know now, I would have walked down the aisle with the ice sculpture and had her stand by the buffet table to keep the shrimp cold.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, so you've had a few bad weddings.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess I was just taking my last best shot at the wedding I shall never have for myself.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, let's face it, Dad: I'm no spring chicken.  Do you really see me getting married again?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess I've had my doubts, but right here, right now, I think: yeah, you're going to meet someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you really think so?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes I do and I'll tell you why.  If Niles can meet a great gal like Sabrina, then there's hope for all of us. _He gets up and exits.  Despite Martin's mistake, Frasier can't help but smile.  End of Act Two._
